> JavaScript Implementation of Port Detector

## Usage

```bash
$ npm i detect-port --save
```

```js
const detect = require('detect-port');

/**
 * callback usage
 */

detect(port, (err, _port) => {
  if (err) {
    console.log(err);
  ***REMOVED***

  if (port == _port) {
    console.log(`port: ${port***REMOVED*** was not occupied`);
  ***REMOVED*** else {
    console.log(`port: ${port***REMOVED*** was occupied, try port: ${_port***REMOVED***`);
  ***REMOVED***
***REMOVED***);

/**
 * for a yield syntax instead of callback function implement
 */

const co = require('co');

co(function *() {
  const _port = yield detect(port);

  if (port == _port) {
    console.log(`port: ${port***REMOVED*** was not occupied`);
  ***REMOVED*** else {
    console.log(`port: ${port***REMOVED*** was occupied, try port: ${_port***REMOVED***`);
  ***REMOVED***
***REMOVED***);

/**
 * use as a promise
 */

detect(port)
  .then(_port => {
    if (port == _port) {
      console.log(`port: ${port***REMOVED*** was not occupied`);
    ***REMOVED*** else {
      console.log(`port: ${port***REMOVED*** was occupied, try port: ${_port***REMOVED***`);
    ***REMOVED***
  ***REMOVED***)
  .catch(err => {
    console.log(err);
  ***REMOVED***);

```

## Command Line Tool

```shell
$ npm i detect-port -g
```

### Quick Start

```shell
# get an available port randomly
$ detect

# detect pointed port
$ detect 80

# more help
$ detect --help
```
